qas.question: What is the range for the length for international matches in meters?
In what year did the IFAB initially approve a fixed size as a standard pitch dimension for international matches?
When was the IFAB's decision on the fixed size of the pitch become implemented?
What is the range for the length of fields for non international matches in meters?
What is the range for the width for international matches in meters?
What is the range for the height for local matches in meters?
What year did the IFAB initially reject a fixed size as a standard pitch dimension for international matches?
What is the range for the depth for international matches in meters?

plausible_answers.text: a fixed size of 105 m (344 ft) long and 68 m (223 ft) wide as a standard pitch dimension for international matches

qas.question: What is the length of the pitch for international child matches?

context: The length of the pitch for international adult matches is in the range of <a0_0><b5_0><b9_0>100–110 m<b9_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> (110–120 yd) and the width is in the range of <a4_0><b7_0>64–75 m<b7_0/><a4_0/> (70–80 yd). Fields for non-international matches may be <a3_0>90–120 m<a3_0/> (100–130 yd) length and 45–90 m (50–100 yd) in width, provided that the pitch does not become square. In <a1_0><b6_0>2008<b6_0/><a1_0/>, the IFAB initially approved <b8_0>a fixed size of 105 m (344 ft) long and 68 m (223 ft) wide as a standard pitch dimension for international matches<b8_0/>; however, this decision was later put on hold and was <a2_0>never<a2_0/> actually implemented.
